summary.para: Defines a health policy used to evaluate the health of the cluster specific to cluster upgrade.

remarks.para: It’s used together with to evaluate cluster health and determine whether the monitored cluster upgrade is successful or needs to be rolled back.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets the maximum allowed percentage of nodes health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.

value.para: The maximum allowed percentage of delta health degradation. Allowed values are integer values from zero to 100.

Docs.remarks: The delta is measured between the state of the nodes at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the nodes at the time of the health evaluation. The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion to make sure the global state of the cluster is within tolerated limits. The default value is 10%.

exception.para: The specified value was outside the range of integer values from zero to 100.

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum allowed percentage of upgrade domain nodes health degradation allowed during cluster upgrades.

value.para: The maximum allowed percentage of upgrade domain delta health degradation. Allowed values are integer values from zero to 100.

Docs.remarks: The delta is measured between the state of the upgrade domain nodes at the beginning of upgrade and the state of the upgrade domain nodes at the time of the health evaluation. The check is performed after every upgrade domain upgrade completion for all completed upgrade domains to make sure the state of the upgrade domains is within tolerated limits. The default value is 15%.

exception.para: The specified value was outside the range of integer values from zero to 100.
